summary: This is a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office to Judge Alison J. Nathan notifying the court that a grand jury has returned a superseding indictment (S2) in the case against Ghislaine Maxwell. The letter details the new charges, which extend the alleged conspiracy timeline to 2004 and add a fourth minor victim (Minor Victim-4), and addresses the impact on discovery, disclosures, and pending motions.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case, charged with conspiracy to entice minors to travel, conspiracy to transport minors, sex trafficking conspiracy, and sex trafficking of a minor.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case, to whom this notification letter is addressed.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who submitted this letter.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the subject of an investigation whose associates were also investigated; his case is related to the charges against Maxwell.

connections.description: The document references the investigation of Jeffrey Epstein and his associates, implicating Maxwell in related conspiracies.
The S2 indictment specifically identifies Minor Victim-4 as a victim of Maxwell's alleged conspiracies between 2001 and 2004.
Strauss, as U.S. Attorney, is representing the government in its prosecution of Maxwell.

events.title: Superseding Indictment Returned
events.description: A grand jury sitting in Manhattan returned a superseding indictment (S2) against Ghislaine Maxwell, adding new charges and extending the alleged conspiracy timeline.

events.title: Scheduled Trial Date
events.description: The trial for Ghislaine Maxwell was scheduled to proceed on this date, as referenced in the government's letter.

events.title: Extended Conspiracy Period
events.description: The superseding indictment alleges the conspiracy involving Ghislaine Maxwell continued through approximately 2004, specifically involving Minor Victim-4 during this period.

events.title: Scheduled Witness Statement Production
events.description: The government intends to begin production of non-testifying witness statements from over 250 witnesses related to the Epstein investigation by this date.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
40 Foley Square, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: A superseding indictment (S2) was returned, extending the alleged conspiracy timeline from 1997 to 2004 and adding a fourth minor victim (Minor Victim-4).
Two new charges were added: Count Five (sex trafficking conspiracy) and Count Six (sex trafficking of a minor), both related to Minor Victim-4.
The government stated it had already produced all Rule 16 discovery material relevant to the new allegations, having approached discovery as covering a period through at least 2005.
The superseding indictment was returned by a grand jury in Manhattan, rendering moot a defense motion to dismiss based on the prior use of a White Plains grand jury.
The government planned to produce statements from over 250 non-testifying witnesses related to the Jeffrey Epstein investigation by April 12, 2021.
